definition: lit. heads rubbing together (idiom)/fig. very close relationship
ear/handle (archaeology)/and that is all (Classical Chinese)
temples/hair on the temples
mutually/with one another/manservant/boy servant/guy (derog.)
variant of 廝|厮[si1]
grindstone/to grind/to turn round
to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist

sentences.english: Facial expression agreeable sweetheart of quite intimate.
sentences.chinese: 神情好似情人间的耳鬓厮磨。

sentences.english: If someone prayed for the family to be closer, do you think God zaps them with warm fuzzy feelings.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人祈求家庭和睦，上帝是给他耳鬓厮磨的感觉。

sentences.english: Under Iran's Islamic law, unmarried couples are not allowed to mingle.
sentences.chinese: 按照伊朗的伊斯兰教法，未婚恋人是不能耳鬓厮磨的。

definition: tender/affectionate/tenderness
to bill and coo (idiom)/to whisper sweet nothings to one another/to be very much in love
touching (emotions)/lingering (illness)
to have sexual intercourse
to share the bed/(fig.) to be married
see 月下花前[yue4 xia4 hua1 qian2]
to tangle with/to get involved/to pester
the pleasure of close intimacy in a couple (idiom)/sexual intercourse
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
to stay together/to rely on one another
loath to part (idiom); emotionally close and unwilling to separate
whispering in a low voice (idiom); murmuring
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between
in love and inseparable
